title: Stock Futures Rise, Oil Falls, Extending Volatility Amid Ukraine War
sub_head: European shares jump; Russiaâ€™s stock market remains shut
body:
Oil prices fell, while U.S. stocks were poised to open higher, extending a volatile spell as investors track the economic fallout of the war in Ukraine.
Futures for the S&P 500 rose 1.8% Wednesday, a day after the benchmark stocks gauge fell for a fourth-consecutive session. Contracts for the technology-focused Nasdaq-100 added 2.2%, while those for the Dow Jones Industrial Average advanced 1.6%.
